text:
Sally Pierone (10 February 1921 – 22 June 2018) was an American art director and psychiatrist. In 1952, she worked at the American Embassy in Paris creating posters, booklets and displays of the Marshall Plan to help rebuild Europe after World War II.
Pierone died in Pasadena, California on 22 June 2018 from renal failure at the age of 97.
